alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 12:07AM EST until January 07 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Carroll County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will fall at 1 inch or greater per hour overnight. Visibility will drop down to one quarter mile or less during the heaviest snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
